intro: Lastrea simulans, commonly known as the false poinsettia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green. It produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers surrounded by the showy bracts. Lastrea simulans is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant foliage and seasonal color changes.
